00001 ######################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  This is a Parser class that implements a number or formula
00004 #  with units.  It is a temporary version until the Parser can
00005 #  handle it directly.
00006 #
00007 
00008 package Parser::Legacy::ObjectWithUnits;
00009 
00010 sub name {'object'};
00011 sub cmp_class {'an Object with Units'};
00012 sub makeValue {
00013   my $self = shift; my $value = shift;
00014   my %options = (context=>$self->context,@_);
00015   Value::makeValue($value,%options);
00016 }
00017 
00018 sub new {
00019   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00020   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00021   my $num = shift; my $units = shift;
00022   Value::Error("You must provide a ".$self->name) unless defined($num);
00023   ($num,$units) = splitUnits($num) unless $units;
00024   Value::Error("You must provide units for your ".$self->name) unless $units;
00025   Value::Error("Your units can only contain one division") if $units =~ m!/.*/!;
00026   $num = $self->makeValue($num,context=>$context);
00027   my %Units = getUnits($units);
00028   Value::Error($Units{ERROR}) if ($Units{ERROR});
00029   $num->{units} = $units;
00030   $num->{units_ref} = \%Units;
00031   $num->{isValue} = 1;
00032   bless $num, $class;
00033 }

00035 ##################################################
00036 
00037 #
00038 #  Find the units for the formula and split that off
00039 #
00040 my $aUnit = '(?:'.getUnitNames().')(?:\s*(?:\^|\*\*)\s*[-+]?\d+)?';
00041 my $unitPattern = $aUnit.'(?:\s*[/* ]\s*'.$aUnit.')*';
00042 my $unitSpace = "($aUnit) +($aUnit)";
00043 sub splitUnits {
00044   my $string = shift;
00045   my ($num,$units) = $string =~ m!^(.*?(?:[)}\]0-9a-z]|\d\.))\s*($unitPattern)\s*$!o;
00046   if ($units) {
00047     while ($units =~ s/$unitSpace/$1*$2/) {};
00048     $units =~ s/ //g;
00049     $units =~ s/\*\*/^/g;
00050   }
00051   return ($num,$units);
00052 }
00053 
00054 #
00055 #  Sort names so that longest ones are first, and then alphabetically
00056 #  (so we match longest names before shorter ones).
00057 #
00058 sub getUnitNames {
00059   local ($a,$b);
00060   join('|',sort {
00061     return length($b) <=> length($a) if length($a) != length($b);
00062     return $a cmp $b;
00063   } keys(%Units::known_units));
00064 }
00065 
00066 #
00067 #  Get the units hash and fix up the errors
00068 #
00069 sub getUnits {
00070   my $units = shift;
00071   my %Units = Units::evaluate_units($units);
00072   if ($Units{ERROR}) {
00073     $Units{ERROR} =~ s/ at ([^ ]+) line \d+(\n|.)*//;
00074     $Units{ERROR} =~ s/^UNIT ERROR:? *//;
00075   }
00076   return %Units;
00077 }
00078 
00079 #
00080 #  Convert units to TeX format
00081 #  (fix superscripts, put terms in \rm,
00082 #   and make a \frac out of fractions)
00083 #
00084 sub TeXunits {
00085   my $units = shift;
00086   $units =~ s/\^\(?([-+]?\d+)\)?/^{$1}/g;
00087   $units =~ s/\*/\\,/g;
00088   return '{\rm '.$units.'}' unless $units =~ m!^(.*)/(.*)$!;
00089   my $displayMode = WeBWorK::PG::Translator::PG_restricted_eval(q!$main::displayMode!);
00090   return '{\textstyle\frac{'.$1.'}{'.$2.'}}' if ($displayMode eq 'HTML_tth');
00091   return '{\textstyle\frac{\rm\mathstrut '.$1.'}{\rm\mathstrut '.$2.'}}';
00092 }
00093 
00094 ##################################################
00095 
00096 #
00097 #  Replace the cmp_parse with one that removes the units
00098 #  from the student answer and checks them.  The answer
00099 #  value is adjusted by the factors, and then checked.
00100 #  Finally, the units themselves are checked.
00101 #
00102 sub cmp_parse {
00103   my $self = shift; my $ans = shift;
00104   #
00105   #  Check that the units are defined and legal
00106   #
00107   my ($num,$units) = splitUnits($ans->{student_ans});
00108   unless (defined($num) && defined($units) && $units ne '') {
00109     $self->cmp_Error($ans,"Your answer doesn't look like ".lc($self->cmp_class));
00110     return $ans;
00111   }
00112   if ($units =~ m!/.*/!) {
00113     $self->cmp_Error($ans,"Your units can only contain one division");
00114     return $ans;
00115   }
00116   my %Units = getUnits($units);
00117   if ($Units{ERROR}) {$self->cmp_Error($ans,$Units{ERROR}); return $ans}
00118   #
00119   #  Check the numeric part of the answer
00120   #   and adjust the answer strings
00121   #
00122   $self->adjustCorrectValue($ans,$self->{units_ref}{factor}/$Units{factor});
00123   $ans->{student_ans} = $num;
00124   $ans = $self->cmp_reparse($ans);
00125   $ans->{student_ans} .= " " . $units;
00126   $ans->{preview_text_string}  .= " ".$units;
00127   $ans->{preview_latex_string} .= '\ '.TeXunits($units);
00128   #
00129   return $ans unless $ans->{ans_message} eq '';
00130   #
00131   #  Check that we have an actual number, and check the units
00132   #
00133   if (!defined($ans->{student_value}) || $self->checkStudentValue($ans->{student_value})) {
00134     $ans->{student_value} = undef; $ans->score(0);
00135     $self->cmp_Error($ans,"Your answer doesn't look like a number with units");
00136   } else {
00137     $ans->{student_value} = $self->new($num,$units);
00138     foreach my $funit (keys %{$self->{units_ref}}) {
00139       next if $funit eq 'factor';
00140       next if $self->{units_ref}{$funit} == $Units{$funit};
00141       $self->cmp_Error($ans,"The units for your answer are not correct")
00142         unless $ans->{isPreview};
00143       $ans->score(0); last;
00144     }
00145   }
00146   return $ans;
00147 }
00148 
00149 #
00150 #  Fix the correct answer so that the value matches the student's units
00151 #
00152 sub adjustCorrectValue {
00153   my $self = shift; my $ans = shift;
00154   my $factor = shift;
00155   $ans->{correct_value}{data}[0] *= $factor;
00156 }
00157 
00158 sub cmp_reparse {Value::cmp_parse(@_)}

00162 #
00163 #  Customize for NumberWithUnits
00164 #
00165 
00166 package Parser::Legacy::NumberWithUnits;
00167 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Legacy::ObjectWithUnits Value::Real);
00168 
00169 sub name {'number'};
00170 sub cmp_class {'a Number with Units'};
00171 
00172 sub makeValue {
00173   my $self = shift; my $value = shift;
00174   my %options = (context => $self->context,@_);
00175   my $num = Value::makeValue($value,%options);
00176   Value::Error("A number with units must be a constant, not %s",lc(Value::showClass($num)))
00177     unless Value::isReal($num);
00178   return $num;
00179 }
00180 
00181 sub checkStudentValue {
00182   my $self = shift; my $student = shift;
00183   return $student->class ne 'Real';
00184 }
00185 
00186 sub promote {
00187   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00188   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00189   my $x = (scalar(@_) ? shift : $self);
00190   return $x->inContext($context) if (ref($x) eq $class || Value::isReal($x)) && scalar(@_) == 0;
00191   return $self->new($context,$x,@_);
00192 }
00193 
00194 sub string {
00195   my $self = shift;
00196   Value::Real::string($self,@_) . ' ' . $self->{units};
00197 }
00198 
00199 sub TeX {
00200   my $self = shift;
00201   my $n = Value::Real::string($self,@_);
00202   $n =~ s/E\+?(-?)0*([^)]*)/\\times 10^{$1$2}/i; # convert E notation to x10^(...)
00203   return $n . '\ ' . Parser::Legacy::ObjectWithUnits::TeXunits($self->{units});
00204 }

00213 package Parser::Legacy::FormulaWithUnits;
00214 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Legacy::ObjectWithUnits Value::Formula);

00216 sub name {'formula'};
00217 sub cmp_class {'a Formula with Units'};
00218 
00219 sub makeValue {
00220   my $self = shift; my $value = shift;
00221   my %options = (context => $self->context,@_);
00222   $self->Package("Formula")->new($options{context},$value);
00223 }
00224 
00225 sub checkStudentValue {
00226   my $self = shift; my $student = shift;
00227   return $student->type ne 'Number';
00228 }
00229 
00230 sub adjustCorrectValue {
00231   my $self = shift; my $ans = shift;
00232   my $factor = shift;
00233   my $f = $ans->{correct_value};
00234   $f->{tree} = $f->Item("BOP")->new($f,'*',$f->{tree},$f->Item("Value")->new($f,$factor));
00235 }
00236 
00237 sub string {
00238   my $self = shift;
00239   Parser::string($self,@_) . ' ' . $self->{units};
00240 }
00241 
00242 sub TeX {
00243   my $self = shift;
00244   Parser::TeX($self,@_) . '\ ' . Parser::Legacy::ObjectWithUnits::TeXunits($self->{units});
00245 }
